notes: Initial report received from customer. Vehicle was rear-ended while stopped at red light.
Police report indicates other driver was at fault - ran red light.
Customer complains of minor neck pain, requesting medical evaluation.
Vehicle damage assessment shows significant rear bumper and trunk damage.
Estimate from certified repair shop: $8,200 for parts and labor.
Customer reported burst pipe in basement at 3 AM during freezing temperatures.
Water damage affected finished basement, hardwood floors, and personal property.
Plumber's report confirms pipe failure due to inadequate insulation.
Restoration company estimate: $12,000 for water extraction and repairs.
Customer provided receipts for damaged electronics and furniture totaling $3,000.
Severe hailstorm in customer's area on January 8th confirmed by weather service.
Multiple dents on hood and cracked windshield documented with photos.
No other vehicle damage found during inspection.
Approved repair shop estimate: $3,150 including windshield replacement.
Fast-track approval given due to clear weather-related cause.
Customer visited ER with chest pain and shortness of breath.
EKG and blood tests performed - results showed anxiety-related symptoms.
Discharged after 4 hours of observation with clean bill of health.
Missing: itemized hospital bill and physician notes.
Follow-up call scheduled with customer to obtain required documentation.
Kitchen fire started from faulty electrical outlet behind stove.
Fire department report confirms electrical origin - no negligence found.
Significant smoke and fire damage to kitchen cabinets, appliances, and adjoining dining room.
Electrical inspection required before reconstruction can begin.
Customer relocated to temporary housing - rental assistance approved.
